body.name: Delta Children Haven 6 Drawer Dresser with Interlocking Drawers - Greenguard Gold Certified, White
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Friday, February 16. Order within 3 hrs 50 mins
FREE delivery Tuesday, February 20. Order within 20 hrs 35 mins
features: VERSATILE STORAGE: This dresser features 6 drawers for plenty of storage space | Classic silhouette offers timeless style | To convert your dresser into a convenient changing table purchase the Delta Children #0550 Topper (sold separately)

GREENGUARD GOLD CERTIFIED: This dresser meets the most stringent chemical emissions standards to create a healthier home for your child. Tested for more than 10,000 chemicals and VOCs, this dresser is certified to contribute to cleaner indoor air

SAFE OPTION: Interlocking drawer system limits the number of drawers that can be opened at one time | Tested to meet the current requirements of ASTM F2057, the mandatory CPSC safety standard that protects children from tip-over incidents

QUALITY MATERIAL: Made of sustainable woods like New Zealand pine and TSCA compliant engineered wood | Tested for lead and other toxic elements to meet or exceed government and ASTM safety standards | Non-toxic paint is lead and phthalate safe
SIZE: Assembled dimensions: 47”W x 19”D x 33.75”H | Interior Drawer Size: 17.5”W x 13.5”D x 4.75”H | Easy assembly | Securely attach dresser to wall with included tipover restraint
body.description: Beautifully made and incredibly versatile, the Haven 6 Drawer Dresser with Interlocking Drawers by Delta Children offers classic storage for the nursery and beyond. Designed to outlast trends and changing tastes, it boasts six spacious drawers and a timeless silhouette. For your child’s safety, this dresser is outfitted with an interlocking drawer system that limits the number of drawers that can be opened at one time. Plus, it’s GREENGUARD Gold Certified, which means it’s built to contribute to cleaner air for a healthy home.This Delta Children dresser is tested to meet the current requirements of ASTM F2057, the mandatory CPSC safety standard that protects young children from furniture tip-over incidents. For your children’s safety, only purchase dressers that comply with this standard. For additional security, Delta Children strongly recommends that all dressers in your home be anchored; all Delta dressers include a wall anchor. To learn how to properly secure your dresser, please see the product assembly instructions or visit our website.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 5, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Very nice dresser!!
reviews.reviewText: I did a lot of browsing and reading of reviews before deciding to order this one. The manufacturers of “baby furniture” seem to offer a better product than others within the price category. I also liked the size. Some of the dressers were very short.The dresser came well packaged. All the pieces were pristine and all hardware was provided. Other than a mislabeling of a few parts in the pictured directions (follow the text which is accurate) assembly was straight forward. We buy a lot of box furniture and my husband says this was a breeze to put together. It took him several hours using a drill for all the screws.It is solid and heavy. I will change out the knobs when I find some I like since this is going in a guest room rather than a nursery. But for now I do like the chunky size of the ones it came with. The color is lovely—soft white with a soft sheen.The only negative for me is how thin the legs are. Be careful moving this dresser.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 27, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Drawers stick/don’t open
reviews.reviewText: Dresser is beautiful and was made out of seemingly good qualify materials. Assembly was pretty straightforward, it took my husband and I about an hour and a half to put it all together. The drawers on the left side all typically open with ease, but the drawers on the right side either do not open, or they get stuck and need several attempts to open them. Pretty disappointed that this seems to be an issue from the manufacturer. Attempting to reposition the manufacturers slides to see if it will help after reading others reviews.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 19, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars DO NOT BUY
reviews.reviewText: This is the absolute worst dresser! Only one drawer and open at a time, IF you can even manage to get one open. All drawers must be pushed in, at the exact right angle or none of them will open. It’s super frustrating! Now at 34 weeks, I’m going to have to hunt for a reliable dresser.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 12, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 2.0 out of 5 stars Cheap but looks decent
reviews.reviewText: This is clearly cheaper than the other dresser I have (which was only $200 more). The drawers are a bit sticky, you can only open one at a time. The overall structure seems sound, I’m not worried about it tipping. Likely wouldn’t purchase again

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Best drawer dresser for babies
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded. Easy to assemble very sturdy and has safety lock so all the drawers don’t open at once also the babies changer table is nice and great for the purpose.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 16, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Drawers will not open.
reviews.reviewText: Smaller then i expected and the drawers will not open anymore. I have clothes in the dresser and can not get the drawers open. The top of the dresser board was chipped. Not great quality - getting rid of

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 7, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 2.0 out of 5 stars Drawers don’t work
reviews.reviewText: I’m furious. I just took 3 days to set this up myself and the drawers don’t open and close correctly. This company has done us wrong by continuing to sell something that doesn’t work properly. I hoped they would have any bugs fixed but apparently not.
